By: 

[![xNQ7yEx.png](http://i.imgur.com/xNQ7yEx.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123653-Blackbird-Aviation-LEGACY-LINEUP-PREVIEW)

* * *
**SHiftER's Slapstick Sketchfab Services!**

**What's Dis?**

Hello, everyone! This is SHiftER2O, and bringing you . .. something I have debate on whether it should be posted on the Space Exchange. Technically, we would need to exchange craft files for this to work, so anyways..

So yeah, Rendering Services! For when you DON't have time [sign up for sketchfab](https://sketchfab.com/) and to sit and upload models with a [very easy model uploader,](https://github.com/sketchfab/ksp-exporter) well you got one man ready for that job ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**How Dis?**

Basic as is. You can PM me any craft file you want, and I render them for you. Fill up this thing here:

Name Of Craft :

Category : (Heavy Lifter, Replica, SSTO, Etc. Etc. Can be multiple)

Company : (If None, then Username is what I'll Put)

Up To 5 Details : (For Annotations!)

Link-Pass : (Where you want me to post the link, PM you or post it at your company or whatever)

And WALAH!! Wait a few moments, (Minutes, Hours, Days, YEARS ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) Depending on me) and I'll PM you the link, or post it anywhere you'll want me to ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**WARNING!!:** Currently, with the sketchfab converter, there are bugs with struts and fuel lines, so beware! Model renders could get quite messy with excessive struts!! But these do not reflect the actual craft file when loaded in-game.

**I want do Dis Miself!!**

Me being too slow? Well No Problem! It's quite easier for you to do this by yourself, REALLY ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Just follow this video here:

<iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/127469305" width="1280" height="720" frameborder="0" title="How to publish your Kerbal Space Program craft to Sketchfab" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Now, isn't that too easy? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) It's YOUR TURN ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

* * *

**The Render Repositry!**

**COMPANIES!!**

I'll make it myself by removing the buggy parts before converting

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-05T08:52:26Z" title="06/05/2015 08:52  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 5, 2015</time> by RevanCorana**

Actually, since I'm at work and I won't likely have the time to sit in front of my home computer and do it in the whole weekend (Nice weekend trip! Yay summer! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif))... could you perhaps do the [Longsword](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/122347-Longsword-Big-Reds-to-orbit-at-25-payload-fraction)? Most of the details and the link for the file is in the thread, ask if I forgot anything. Just to have a nice form-format:

Name Of Craft : Longsword

Category : Heavy Lifter, SSTO.

Company : R-SUV, of course

Up To 5 Details : See the craft description for details? I wrote a nice guide there.

Link-Pass : Err... R-SUV, I guess, or its thread but I can lift the link from anywhere (don't worry, I'll credit it of course)

Also, let this message serve as congrats on a nice idea, because I have run out of rep for you until more awesomeness comes to the forum.

Rune. I'm overly proud of that one.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-05T09:16:28Z" title="06/05/2015 09:16  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 5, 2015</time> by Rune**
So, what parts dont get rendered?

> 
> So, what parts dont get rendered?

Well everything gets rendered, but struts tend to get their connecting end offset by some reason.

- - - Updated - - -

Docking port covers are not rendered, cargobays are always open, chute covers are not rendered, only the basic wheels are deployed when rendered, I'm diving deep into the codes here :/

- - - Updated - - -

The couplers are not rendered, need toimport it as materials first. Darnmit.

- - - Updated - - -

The small 0.625 SAS is also rendered as 1.25m, the Vernor engines are way smaller than they should be and structural bi/tri/quadcouplers are also rendered as empty air. You should maybe include a list of that parts in the OP, so everybody can see what he should \*maybe\* change.

Nice thread idea, by the way! I would submit some of my KME craft here, but I already have a sketchfab account ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).
It would be nice if you could do some of my craft- link in sig. Althogh most of them are outdated, there are some that still work.

> 
> It would be nice if you could do some of my craft- link in sig. Althogh most of them are outdated, there are some that still work.

Well, give me a definition of some, and ALL ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) No seriously, specify on what crafts I am to render?

- - - Updated - - -

I don't think changing parts would be necessary, because this is rather a recreational preview than anything else really. The craft in-game is what matters most, and this sketchfab thing is, just for those guys who want a render or those who're too lazy to get pics (Like me ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

I hope it gets updated soon.

> 
> ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) AWESOME!! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) How did you fix it?

Thanks I created a second file save and manually removed all the buggy parts and tried to move the over-scaled ones the best I could

And then I also added a few visual effect in sketchfab and changed the field of view. (settings > 3d settings)

> 
> Thanks I created a second file save and manually removed all the buggy parts and tried to move the over-scaled ones the best I could
> And then I also added a few visual effect in sketchfab and changed the field of view.

Well, it seems that you won't be needing my services any more, you do a fantastic job at rendering!![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Awesome tool! I need to check it by myself too!;d

I didn't know that was how rendering was made in ksp.

Should I clear up this one? It could be glorious with the interior.
